page.title: 11GOVERNMENT:WOODTON PARISH
page.content: The Parish Council consists of 7 members of the community,elected every 4 years.It is non-political;all elected members are unpaid but the Clerk receives a small salary, calculated as a fraction of the parish Penny Rate. The Council's main functions are to express local opinion on planning applications & to promote action beneficial to the village. Examples here include maintenance work on a brook to deter flooding,reporting the state of the roads,considering bus services & reporting those heavy lorries disregarding an "access only" sign.It is currently trying to purchase some land for an additional playing field. The council is represented on bodies such as the Village Hall Committee,the School Governors,a local charity & emergency & community Services.
